item.title: Chris Dreja
item.description: Christopher Walenty Dreja is an English musician, best known as the rhythm guitarist and bassist for The Yardbirds.

item.title: Roger Waters
item.description: George Roger Waters is an English songwriter, singer, bassist, and composer. In 1965, he co-founded the progressive rock band Pink Floyd. Waters initially served solely as the bassist, but following the departure of singer-songwriter Syd Barrett in 1968, he also became their lyricist, co-lead vocalist, and conceptual leader.

item.title: Leo Lyons
item.description: Leo David William Lyons is an English musician who was most notably the bassist of the blues rock band Ten Years After.

item.title: Andrey Makarevich
item.description: Andrey Vadimovich Makarevich PAR is a Soviet and Russian rock musician and the founder of Russia's oldest still active rock band Mashina Vremeni.

item.title: Marc Ford
item.description: Marc Ford is an American blues-rock guitarist. He is a former lead guitarist of the rock and roll jam band The Black Crowes and the leader of his own bands: Burning Tree, Marc Ford & The Neptune Blues Club, Jefferson Steelflex, Fuzz Machine, and Marc Ford & The Sinners. He is currently performing with other former Black Crowes members in The Magpie Salute.

item.title: George Thorogood
item.description: George Lawrence Thorogood is an American musician, singer and songwriter from Wilmington, Delaware. His 'high-energy boogie-blues' sound became a staple of 1980s rock radio, with hits like his original songs 'Bad to the Bone' and 'I Drink Alone'. He has also helped to popularize older songs by American icons, such as 'Move It on Over', 'Who Do You Love?', and 'House Rent Boogie/One Bourbon, One Scotch, One Beer'.

item.title: Bill Wyman
item.description: Bill Wyman is an English musician, record producer, songwriter and singer. He was the bass guitarist for the English rock and roll band the Rolling Stones from 1962 until 1993. Since 1997 he has recorded and toured with his own band, Bill Wyman's Rhythm Kings. He has worked producing records and films, and has scored music for film in films and television.

item.title: Jimmy Page
item.description: James Patrick Page is an English musician, songwriter, and record producer who achieved international success as the guitarist and founder of the rock band Led Zeppelin.

item.title: Jerry Garcia
item.description: Jerome John 'Jerry' Garcia was an American singer-songwriter and guitarist, best known for his work as the lead guitarist and as a vocalist with the band the Grateful Dead, which came to prominence during the counterculture era in the 1960s. Although he disavowed the role, Garcia was viewed by many as the leader or 'spokesman' of the group.

item.title: Gary Moore
item.description: Robert William Gary Moore was a Northern Irish guitarist and singer-songwriter. According to Ultimate Classic Rock, Moore had a 'restless career trajectory—taking in blues, rock, heavy metal, jazz-fusion and other styles over four and a half decades'. He is often described as a virtuoso guitarist.
